title: Album Page, "Sketch of Garland and Shield with Three Flames, Possibly France?", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on thick, off-white wove paper with deckled edges, folded tipped into binding with fabric
markings: Watermark: left side of sheet: C inscribed in shield;  right side of sheet: six-pointed star / I De More (?)
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, below each blossom on garland: bigger / bigger; below garland: bett. . r cols side (?). Verso, in graphite, upper right corner (as bound): 114; lower right corner 104.
dimensions: Sheet: 42 x 60 cm (16 9/16 x 23 5/8 in.), irregular
description: Rectangular sheet that has been folded and tipped into binding depicting a quickly sketched and irregularly shaped shield with three flames.  The left side of the shield is tethered by a garland with leaves to a round fixture from which is suspended two strands of ribbon.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Sketch of Garland and Shield with Three Flames, Possibly France?", late 19th century.Graphite on thick, off-white wove paper with deckled edges, folded tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-279.
